column4: Greetings, Anyone willing to help out with ubuntu 12.10 installer issues?
Tell us what the problem is.
Couple of things, have you checked the md5sum of the ISO or disc?

Boot the install using nomodeset, hit f6 at the choice of try or install gui at startup, choose nomodeset and boot in and try the install again. Make sure you tick the download updates in the install gui.
- already did that.  a couple of times.  it doesn't seem to make a difference if I have nomodeset on or not.

Ah, well you could do a net install from the mini cd, it is a text install, or you might try adding the drivers from this PPA, I'm not sure if this requires a logout or reboot which makes it moot. http://www.howopensource.com/2012/10/install-nvidia-geforce-driver-in-ubuntu-12-10-12-04-using-ppa/
Actually that ppa is not covering 12.10 as of now.
- how do I check md5sum of the disk or ISO?
First link is the easiest to follow.
- the md5sum of the ISO is perfect.
Cool, I would try the net install if it was me, if I thought I could get the graphic loaded after install. You might also try a usb, personally I would go with what gets it installed.
The live cd runs you could load the usb from there and download the mini.
You can't at the least run nomodeset and get the desktop to show?
we are not trying the install just downloading a tiny iso and loading the usb.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/MinimalCD
Did you boot the cd with the f6 nomodeset option?
Download however you can and use a usb loader like unetbootin.
- installing unetbootin right now.
...OK.  I have mini.iso loaded on a usb drive
Cool boot it and since it is a net install, make sure you have it plugged in with the etho cord, and install the text gui's are easy to follow, you will have a chance to load the desktop you want.
- it boots to a prompt.  "boot:"
-  starts loading, then does the same thing... blacks out says it can't display this video mode.
Not sure what to say, this has gone beyond my help.
-  thanks for all your assistance.
